items.value: You approach your home, built with the sweat of your brow - years of hard work. Now you have no choice but leave it behind.
Let's hurry and pack whatever we can fit in Rosita, and on our own backs
You approach Uramita, a small town where your family used to live many years ago.
We can try to trade some of what we have here.
You approach Dabeiba, a trade center of the region growing increasingly dangerous.
We can try to trade some of what we have here.

A group of people armed with old rifles and machetes approaches.

One man moves forward from the group while several men point to you with their guns.

“You look like a god-damned cachiporro, I know one when I see it!“
I’m not a cachiporro, I swear! Please let me pass!
Death to all the chusma, you will destroy our country... You shall burn in hell!

The man spits on your face before hitting you with the butt of his rifle. Everything blacks out.

When you wake up, the first thing you see is a crowd. You don’t see your family.

You try to move, but your hands are tied. A man grabs your hair and lifts your face. You see many people. Where are you? Your head hurts too much to think and the man speaks.

Look at the faces of the traitors! Know that even if the traitors are children or old people we don’t care! We will pacify this country, with fire and blood if needed!

Everything blacks out again. This time forever.

A group of people armed with old rifles and machetes approaches.

One man moves forward from the group while several men point to you with their guns.

“You look like a god-damned chulavita, I know one when I see it!“
I’m not a chulavita, I swear! Please let me pass!
Death to all the state-backed oppressor land-grabber murderers!

The man spits on your face before hitting you with the butt of his rifle. Everything blacks out.

When you wake up, the first thing you see is a crowd. You don’t see your family.

You try to move, but your hands are tied. A man grabs your hair and lifts your face. You see many people. Where are you? Your head hurts too much to think and the man speaks.

Look at the faces of the traitors! Know that even if the traitors are children or old people we don’t care! We will pacify this country, with fire and blood if needed!

Everything blacks out again. This time forever.

The man turns his back on you, and without looking gives a signal to his men after spitting to the ground.

- Kill them.
Have Mercy!

You see a chance to escape and shout for your family to run to the woods.

Chaos ensues as bullets fly. After a while you stop running and see who’s with you.

Sadly XXX is missing.
God rest his soul.

You see a chance to escape and shout for your family to run to the woods.

Chaos ensues as bullets fly. After a while you stop running and see who’s with you.

God is blessed, you are all able to regroup and continue.
Thank you, holy virgin.

You see a chance to escape and run to the woods.

After a while you stop running and notice you were hit.
Argh!
You see a farm with fat animals and crops ready for harvest. It doesn’t look like there is anyone home.
Call out for help.
Steal some crops and chickens.
“No, no, no! Get out! THIEVES! REBELS! KILLERS!” An old man runs out from the house with a machete, driving your family out of the property.
Run away!
An old man comes out of the house and approaches: Oh no… Please don’t tell me you also come from San Vicente. Come inside and share a meal with me. Helping is the least I could do.
May God bless you and your family.
Hearing no answer, you go ahead and steal some crops and chickens.
God, forgive us.
Some bandoleros approach with machetes and wooden clubs. “Give us your valuables! Or die!”
Drop some items and run.
Fight!
The bandoleros run to grab the items. They are also famished, maybe ran out of their homes too. Using this opportunity, you and your family flee.
Ok
XXX will have to heal minor wounds, but you’ll retain your family’s positions.
Ok
You black out. Your family seems scared but safe. The bandoleros were scared and in a hurry so they only stole some items.
Ok
With no one able to fight, the bandoleros laugh and take some items before leaving.
Curse them.
Unfortunately for the bandoleros, they have more than you have.
Sorry.

The house of our friends, the Zapata...

Burnt down by those who threatened us out of our home.
It's better not to look, kids, and just keep walking...

Ahead on the road you see what appears to be a cart. It has some food inside it that seems edible. The surrounding soil is covered by blood. There are no mules or horses, and no one answer your calls.
Grab all the food. [+20 food]
Leave some food behind. Someone else may need it. [+10 food]

Years ago, when looking at the crystalline waters of this river, at its colors, you’d think there can only exist peace.

Nowadays however, you only think how easily your family will get shot if you stop here.
Don't stop now! We must go!

There was a time when you’d visit the family who lived here.

Back then, you could trust your neighbors. You felt safe.

Now, you’re afraid to ask for help. What if they think you are part of the Chulavitas?
People have been shot for far less...

Your family aproaches what seems like an abandoned house.
Probably another family displaced by violence.
 Should we search for food, risking to be taken as thieves and attacked?
Let's take the risk, we don't have a choice.
No. Let's continue down the road.
Luckily, we found some yuca in the kitchen.
Blessed be our mother the virgin.
We are caught red-handed, and driven off the house by the machete.
Have mercy! Have mercy!

XXX hasn't eaten in days and is now weaker!

You can feed your family members by clicking on their picture in the status bar on the right.

If you fail to do this for several days, they will abandon this world.
I will take care of them!
Click to Start

An entry for Global Game Jam 2023


Music: Camilo Fique
Illustration: Oscar Creart
Narrative Design: Esteban Martínez
Sound Effects and Audio: Juan García
Design, Code, Production: Santiago Zapata

This is the story of the harsh journey of a family fleeing from their beautiful, loved land. Stories like this lie at the roots of many families in Colombia.

Two generations ago, thousands of people were forced to leave their homes in the countryside and seek the relative safety of the cities, as a result of what would later be known as "La Violencia", a time where bipartisan hatred was so high that innocent people were tortured and killed for mere suspicions, or if lucky; forced to leave their homes.

Game Over

You didn't make it to the city.

Better luck next life.
You made it.

Welcome to the big city.

This is just the beginning, many hardships still await for you.

Hopefully all the sacrifices made along the way will be worth this new life.
